author: Anonymous Comp
title: Autograder feedback on the signature of P6, Pset8
question:
Hello! I am a little bit confused about how the autograder is marking the signature of the function  on problem 6 since I got 0% on parts that, in my opinion, I should be getting right. For instance, I recieved the following feedback messages:
 0% of 0.4%       x       c1 has a function type with N arguments: incorrect
0% of 0.4%        x      first argument of c1 has type data type: incorrect
(to avoid giving away information about the solution, I'm writing N and data type instead of the specific number and data type that is provided by the autograder)
I'm very confident that I have the same number of arguments on c1 as the autograder and I'm also very confident that my first argument of c1 matches the autograder. Is there anything I could do to fix this?
  Thank you!
student_answer: You may want to reconsider what exactly a combination function does for compound data.
instructor_answer: looks like you managed to fix the problem
